definitions.definition: The property of being thick (in dimension).
A measure of how thick (in dimension) something is.
definitions.example: The thickness of the Earth's crust varies from two to 70 kilometres.
We upholstered the seat with three thicknesses of cloth to make it more comfortable to sit on.

definitions.definition: The quality of being thick (in consistency).
definitions.example: Whip the cream until it reaches a good thickness.

definitions.definition: The property of being thick (slow to understand).
